sense.name: Make a small hole into, as with a needle or thorn.
sense.commentary: Note: Unlike in Sense 2, the manufacture of a hole is not standing in for the pain.
sense.examples: The nurse pricked my finger to get a small blood sample. Prick the sides of the potato to facilitate rooting.

sense.name: Cause a physical or emotional pain to a sentient being.
sense.examples: A bee pricked my arm yesterday. The needle pricked his skin. The thought of her pricked his conscience. His mannerisms prick my sensibilities.

sense.name: Raise (a body part).
sense.examples: The dog pricked his ears. I pricked up my ears to hear her.
